article:
{{Infobox Organization |name = Enterprize Canada |image = Enterprize Canada 2009
Logo.png |motto = People. Inspire. Ideas. |founded = 2001 |leader_title =
Founder |leader_name = Michael Lee |location = Vancouver, British Columbia
|affiliations = Sauder School of Business  University of British Columbia
|website = [http://www.enterprizecanada.org www.enterprizecanada.org] |Facebook
Page= [http://www.facebook.com/pages/Enterprize-Canada/148866145200990?sk=wall
www.facebook.com/pages/Enterprize-Canada/148866145200990?sk=wall] }}

'Enterprize Canada' is a student-run, not-for-profit organization with the focus
on promoting entrepreneurship while providing opportunities to young
entrepreneurs to grow and develop their ideas. Established in 2001 under the
leadership of founder Michael Lee and other undergraduate business students from
the Sauder School of Business at the University of British Columbia, Enterprize
Canada hosts Canada's largest ["http://www.vancouversun.com/business/Studen-
t+entrepreneurs+compete+cash+Vancouver+conference/6122849/story.html"/ Vancouver
Sun"] student-run business plan competition and entrepreneurship conferen-
ce. [http://www.bdc.ca/en/about/mediaroom/news_releases/2007/20070305.htm?c-
ookie%5Ftest=2/ BDC News Release] Over 250 student-delegates, industry
professionals, and young entrepreneurs from across Canada meet annually in
Vancouver, BC in this two-part event. While the conference and the business plan
competition are the highlight events of the organization, Enterprize Canada
hosts and participates in a number of community-based activities through
workshops, conferences and social events that connects students in universities
across Canada. Since 2009, Enterprize has also hosted the annual miniEnterprize
conference which connects young innovators in across twenty high schools
throughout British
Columbia. [http://www.enterprizecanada.org/community/mini/
miniEnterprize]
categories: Business and industry organizations based in Canada
